abstract.t: This Internet Draft discusses a framework for transporting signalingprotocols (SS7, ISDN and DPNSS) over packet networks. Theframework is referred to as signaling 'backhaul'. The backhaultakes place between a Media Gateway (MG) or Signaling Gateway (SG),which interfaces between the circuit world (PSTN) and the packetworld (IP/ATM), and a Media Gateway Controller (MGC), which providescall processing. It is referred to as 'backhaul' because the gatewayterminates the lower layers of the protocol (i.e. Layer 1 and 2)and backhauls the other layers to the MGC.
